paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The first GIM was represented by a rare variant (rs184097503) in perfect LD with rs28933981 (p.T119M), which is known to enhance the stability of TTR and leads to higher plasma TTR levels and greater thyroxine transport capacity.

functional_data.summary: The variant enhances the stability of TTR and leads to higher plasma TTR levels.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is in perfect linkage disequilibrium with another known variant.
key_quotes: The first GIM was represented by a rare variant (rs184097503) in perfect LD with rs28933981 (p.T119M), which is known to enhance the stability of TTR and leads to higher plasma TTR levels and greater thyroxine transport capacity.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The second GIM was represented by a common variant (rs1667237) at which the minor allele (C) was strongly associated with higher retinol levels.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with higher retinol levels.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with retinol transport.
key_quotes: The second GIM was represented by a common variant (rs1667237) at which the minor allele (C) was strongly associated with higher retinol levels.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for TTR variants were extracted successfully.
